intro: Restio pygmaeus, commonly known as the dwarf restio, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to Mediterranean climates. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
